title: This is what 54 looks like: Sandra Prince works in childcare and presses ice cubes into her eye bags
text:
Sandra Prince works in childcare and lives in London with her partner, Tony. They have four daughters, aged between ten and 16.

ICE CUBEs for eye bags

I’m a night owl, so I usually stay up until 2am, then wake up at 6am and have a power-nap in the day. If I get eye bags, I press a few ice cubes (inside a sealed freezer bag, wrapped in a tea towel) under my eyes for five minutes before bed. The skin looks quite red just after, but I find this helps to soothe puffiness so I look much fresher the next morning. I do it for special occasions.

Sandra Prince, who has four daughters aged between ten and 16, presses ice cubes into her face to get rid of the eye bags

TWO-STEP GLOW

Every night, I apply Bio-Oil (£9.99, boots.com) to my face instead of moisturiser — it’s packed with hydrating vitamins and natural oils. My daughters say I look so shiny! But it soaks in, and my skin feels smoother and plumper. I also take Holland & Barrett Vitamin E 1,000mg (a high dosage) capsules every other day (£45.99). They work so well that my skin gets too oily if I take them daily.

TAKE A HAIR BREAK

Since going grey, I have to colour my roots every two weeks. However, it’s important to give your hair a break from damaging treatments. So, after six months of perming and colouring, I stop — and get full extensions put in for the next six months. It costs £200 to get them re-attached every six weeks as they grow out. But it’s worth it. I love changing my image.

DESIGNER bargains

I love shopping online at youthful High Street brands such as ASOS, Pretty Little Thing, Missguided and Zara. But I like to mix them with designer pieces, which I buy in sales at the Bicester Village outlet in Oxford. I’ve found some amazing bargains there, by Burberry, Versace, Ralph Lauren. The key is to go early, as soon as the shops open.

MIDLIFE FITNESS CHALLENGE

I’ve been working out at home for years, but find it harder to stay in shape now. So I see a weekly personal trainer and have cleaned up my diet: I eat lean meat or fish with vegetables for most dinners — plus one ‘cheat day’. I’ve lost 1 st since June and feel fitter than ever. I recently did a 1,000-squat challenge on You Tube in under an hour!
description: Sandra Prince, 54, presses ice cubes into her eye bags each morning to get rid of them - after four hours sleep - and colours her hair roots every two weeks to hide the greying hairs.
authors: Florence Scordoulis For The Daily Mail
